result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Kenneth Laudon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  To be paid by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for three days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Pay all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Fine of $1,800.00, all costs/surcharges as stated in count one. To be paid in same manner as stated in count one.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety plan signed and filed.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC dated March 4, 2015/Judge Timothy Witkowiak/amend credit for time served to include three days credit on Count 2.***
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to:  Drug Abuse Correctional Center, Attn:  Stephanie, P. O. Box 36, Winnebago, WI  54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19, Judge Cimpl.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing 01/27/2015 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Count two.
ORDER AMENDING JUDGEMENT OF CONVICTION signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request for amended JOC (count two).
Count two.
Count one.
Court previously ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form signed, filed and copy mailed to defendant.
Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Larry L.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4.5 YEARS with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1.

Court finds defendant ISeligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 30 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  2 YEARS thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1800.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Joseph Kenneth Laudon in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Thomas L. Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
Letters in Support of the defendant received and filed.
